reviewText: I got this for my nephew's birthday and it was his favorite gift from the whole party. If you are looking to buy for a young child this is a great DVD.
This DVD made my son's day when I gave it to him. It was in perfect condition and arrived in a timely manner. I couldn't ask for anything better. Great job!!
Our 4 year old has watched it over and over. It is a bit shorter than the movie version of Looney Tunes, but it is good.
Baby Looney Tunes are the best.. My grandsons love watching this over and over.

I watched this show as a kid and wanted nothing more than for my son to get to grow up watching it aslo. I love it!

Bought for a one year olds birthday..  He loves cartoons. He liked this one.  Who doesn't like looney tunes.
I did.

Not too long ago I was browsing a DVD bargain rack and found a collection of the original "Tom and Jerry" cartoons. Remembering how much I enjoyed them in theaters as a kid, I picked up the DVD thinking my little boy (3 1/2) might like them. Well, he did. But in viewing them, I thought these were really made for an audience of mostly adults and my little boy probably couldn't understand most of the humor. Well, he liked to watch them anyhow and every once in a while I'd hear a big chortle. Well, the next time I was at the store, I found a collection of "Tom and Jerry" cartoons made especially for a children's TV program. They looked much the same but the stories and language were angled toward smaller children. My boy enjoyed them too. Then next I found this collection of "Baby Looney Tunes (Volume 1)" with baby versions of the Looney Tunes cartoon characters such as Bugs Bunny, Sylvester Pussycat, Tweety Bird and others. So I bought this set of cartoons especially for my little boy.

He enjoys the cartoons, there's no question about that. But the stories and characters and even the animations are really dumbed down to a very low level. The word sappy comes to mind. It's hard for me to watch along with him. It's just too corny. Even the music is corny. Especially, the music. I can't help but feel that if you want him to appreciate music, why play this really dumbed-down corny stuff for him. And again, he likes the cartoons, but he likes the more adult ones better. Finally, the other night, I asked if he wanted to watch the cartoon again and he said no. I asked what he wanted to watch. He wanted to watch the Green Man (Shrek 2). Well, I think that is saying something. I suppose every child is different and you ought to gear the viewing to a level that is appropriate. Clearly, my boy prefers the more adult things, and I think he's right. However, the "Baby Looney Tunes" cartoons are nicely made and most kids are just going to love them, I'd guess.

Gary Peterson

I wanted my son to watch some of the classic cartoons, and I also needed some variety in our collection. He loves baby looneys! And they even teach lessons in cartoons! I bought vol. 3 in wegmans and its a bit longer than this one, but it has some cute songs too!

We have gotton alot of happy hours watching this DVD. It's my grandson's favorite and I believe that he has gotten alot of valuable learning from this DVD. We love ordering from Amazon because we always recieve our orders early! Great going Amazon!
My son loves the Babies.  When I put on any dvd from this collection I can do whatever I need to around the house without any interuptions from him.  Great collection for kids.
I was pleasantly surprised that my little boy really enjoys these stories. He's only 5 months old but really liked all of the bright colors. He especially likes baby Daffy.
Fun DVD for my 2 little ones. Thye love Baby Loonies, but it is hard to find in stores or on tv. only 48 minutes is the only issue.
My Grandson loves Baby Looney Tunes. I too enjoy them. I hope they never stop making good ole'cartoons like these.
There was only 2 ten minute cartoons, and 2 songs on this DVD. This was way to short for my tastes. My son loves Baby Looney Tunes, but there has to be something out there that offers a little more.
My daughter loves Baby Looney Tunes.  Such cute childrens movies.
